A famous hacker left a message using his signature scheme, confident no one could fake it. Can you forge a valid signature on 0x108b867f30ac9d2a19e5792699002bf0100d490a27249e2f3d11c1cc862193c1ef45eb9b5b482aa56226c812c3cb1a6e9797a22f38241337b85d4640d8982305 using the same weak system?

Public Key (n, e): (10948927091064389150175585930699376627028780634493797240697255309124916140513362255239653908336614589345981517435480028876809094308063114505165654825889189, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{2fwrl2o2}
ciphertext: 0x108b867f30ac9d2a19e5792699002bf0100d490a27249e2f3d11c1cc862193c1ef45eb9b5b482aa56226c812c3cb1a6e9797a22f38241337b85d4640d8982305
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (10948927091064389150175585930699376627028780634493797240697255309124916140513362255239653908336614589345981517435480028876809094308063114505165654825889189, 3)
subtype: rsa_sign_with_low_public_exponent
archetype: signature_schemes
